>From: "Yap Sieh Roy" <sryap@...>
>
>ok,
>
>thanks for the tip, am on lvl 8 now. making patchwork is no prob. so i'm
>looking for something more challenging to learn.
>i'll take a look at blacksmithing :-)
>
>thanks !
>roy
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: Entreri <drizzt@...>
>To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>

>Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] patchwork, studded and reinforced leather
armour
>question

>
>> From: "Entreri" <drizzt@...>
>>
>> I suggest doing only patchwork..after u reach 26[cap for
>> patchwork].STOP...go on to blacksmithing.Making Studded armour is a waste
>of
>> money,its hard and expensive and low AC too,better on making banded mail]
>>
>> 1.Levels1-3:put all 15pt in Tailoring
>> 2.Levels 4-6:by level6,u should maxout ya tailoring
>> 3.Levels7+:all out pts on blacksmithing until "have to pay"stage
>> 4.Levels4-16:sharpening,making skewers
>> 5.Levels17-25:banded armour
>> 6.Levels26++:Not sure heard its bronze plate after banded
>>
>>
>>

>> >From: "Yap Sieh Roy" <sryap@...>
>> >
>> >hi,
>> >
>> >been trying to practise my tailoring skillz.. i got a couple of
questions
>> >abt making armour, hope u guys can help.
>> >
>> >ruined pelt + pattern = patchwork armour
>> >medium pelt + studs + pattern = studded armour
>> >hi-quality pelt + file + pattern = reinforced armour
>> >
>> >the above is as far as i understand from the tailoring book. there is
>only
>> 2
>> >slots in the sewing kit so.patchwork is no problem but what about
studded
>> >and reinforced where 3 items are required? what is the sequence of
making
>> >them ?
>> >
>> >thanks !
>> >roy
